head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 2 distinct parts:

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Isaac of Antioch. Part of the metrical discourse of Isaac of Antioch on the plague in the days ofking David; Jacob of Batnae. Metrical discourses of Jacob of Batnae, chiefly funeral sermons; Ephraim. Metrical discourse of Ephraim of the dead; Isaac of Antioch. Metrical discourses of Isaac of Antioch; Jacob of Batnae. A leaf from a discourse of Jacob of Batnae, probably that entitledܥܠ ܚܝܬ ܡ̈ܝܬܐon the Resurrection. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 24 items.

listBibl.bibl: Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 315, no. 66

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 8 7/8 in. by 5 7/8, consisting of 97 leaves, some of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 1, 12, 20, 23, 30, and 96. The quires, signed with letters, seem to have been originally about 19 in number, but of these the first six, the 8th, and the 15th, are lost, and several others are imperfect, leaves being missing after foll. 10, 28, 68, 96 and 97. There are from 23 to 29 lines in each page.

collation.p: The quires, signed with letters, seem to have been originally about 19 in number, but of these the first six, the 8th, and the 15th, are lost, and several others are imperfect.

item.p: 97 leaves, some of which are much stained and torn, especiallyfoll. 1, 12, 20, 23, 30, and 96. Leaves being missing afterfoll. 10, 28, 68, 96 and 97.

layout.p: There are from 23 to 29 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: This manuscript is written in a good, regular Estrangela of the viith or viiith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Jacob of Batnae. Metrical discourses of Jacob of Batnae; Basil of Caesarea. Exhortation of Basil of Caesarea, addressed to these who are beginning the ascetic life.; John Chrisostom. Discourse of John Chrisostom on Psalm li; Commentary onEcclesiastes, ch. xii. 1—7; Julius of Rome. Letters of Julius of Rome. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 10 items.

msItem.title: Against those who strive against the Divine Incarnation of the Word, with the pretext that He is not consubstantial
msItem.rubric: ܠܘܩܒܠ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܡܬܟܬܫܝܢ ܥܠ ܦܓܪܢܘܬܗ ܐܠܗܝܬܐ̇. ܕܗ̇ܘ ܡܠܬܐ ܒܥܠ̣ܬܐ ܕܠܘ ܒܪ ܐܝܬܘܬܐ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ

listBibl.bibl: Mai, Scriptt. Vett. Nova Collectio, t. vii., p. 168
de Lagarde's edition of the Greek text of Titns Bostrenus, etc. (Berlin, 1859), p. 122.

msItem.author: Julius of Rome
msItem.title: Concerning the Divine Incarnation
msItem.incipit: ܒܡܠܬܗ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܟܕ ܡܗܝܡܢܝܢ̣ܢ. ܙܕܩ̇ ܠ̣ܢ ܕܚܬܝܬܐܝܬ ܢܠܒܟܝܗ̇. ܘܠܐ ܒܝܕ ܗܪ̈ܣܝܘܛܐ ܢܫܬܓܢܐ. ܗ̇ܘ ܓܝܪ ܕܡܬܝܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܒܦܘܡܗ ܡܘܕܐ: ܕܒܪ ܐܢܫܐ ܗܘ ܕܝܢ ܐܟܘܗ ܕܗܘ̣ܐ ܡܢ ܐܢܬܬܗ ܒܪܥܝܢܗ ܠܐ ܡܣܬ̇ܟܠ: ܘܐ̇ܡܪ ܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܠܐ ܐܬܝܠܕ ܡܢ ܐܢܬܬܐ̣. ܠܘܩܒܠ ܡܗܝ̈ܡܢܐ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ̣. ܘܥܡ ܠܐ ܡܗܝ̈ܡܢܐ ܡܬܚ̣ܫܒ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of Letters of Julius of Rome
msItem.author: Julius of Rome
msItem.title: Part of Letters of Julius of Rome
msItem.incipit: ܚ̈ܝܐ ܥܬ̇ܕ ܠܢ ܐܘܢܓܠܝܘܢ ܐܚ̈ܝ.. ܕܡܢܗ ܝܠܦܢܢ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܐܬ݂ܐ ܠܥܠܡܐ. ܘܨܒ̈ܘܬܐ ܐܢܫ̈ܝܬܐ̣. ܫܚܠܦ ܠܬܫܒܘܚܬܐ ܐܠܗܝܬܐ. ܘܠܡܪ̈ܘܡܐ ܫܡ̈ܝܢܐ. ܘܠܡܠܟܘܬܐ ܕܫܡܝܐ. ܘܠܚ̈ܝܐ ܛܘܒ̈ܬܢܐ. ܘܠܬܘܩܢܐ ܕܒܪܝܬܐ ܚܕܬܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 1/4 in. by 5 7/8, consisting of 27 leaves (Add. 14,608, foll. 98—124), some of which are slightly stained and torn, especially foll. 98, 113, 118, and 124. The quires are signed with letters, beginning with ܝܕ. Leaves are wanting after foll. 115, 116, and 124. Foll. 98—110 a are written with from 21 to 25 lines in each page; foll. 110 b—121 are divided into two columns, of from 25 to 34 lines. This manuscript seems to be of the viith cent.

collation.p: The quires are signed with letters, beginning withܝܕ.

item.p: 27 leaves, some of which are slightly stained and torn, especiallyfoll. 98,113,118, and 124. Leaves are wanting afterfoll. 115, 116, and 124.

layout.p: Foll. 98—110 a are written in a good, regular Estrangela, with from 21 to 25 lines in each page
Foll. 110 b—121 are in a more current hand, and are divided into two columns, of from 25 to 34 lines.

handNote.desc: Foll. 98—110 a are written in a good, regular Estrangela, with from 21 to 25 lines in each page
Foll. 110 b—121 are in a more current hand, and are divided into two columns, of from 25 to 34 lines.

item.p: At the end of fol. 107 is written in cursive characters

p.quote: ܟܠ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܢܨܠܐ ܥܠ ܚܛܝܐ ܕܟܬ̣ܒ ܕܢܬܚ̣ܢܢ ܐܝܟ ܓܝ̇ܣܐ ܐܡܝܢ

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.
